home_intro: Widgets and api are the fastest way to benefit from Yucca platform's data
home_intro_widget: Here you find Widgets which can be integrated as components in Angular apps, or as custom elements for other types of web app
home_intro_angularjs: Here you find AngularJS's Widgets, and the Composer, a tool which lets you try widgets in real time with current datasets and create dashboards prototypes
home_intro_api: Widgets are the fastest way to benefit from Yucca platform's data
page_install_overview_intro_plain:
Yucca offers a series of widgets which can be used to represent relevant data. All widgets are highly customizable, in choosing data to show and in the appearance.
Depending on the technology used, you need to choose widgets in version 1.0 or widgets in version 2.0

Widgets 1.0

Those are widgets developed in AngularJS, suitable to be used in AngularJS webapp and in not single-page webapps. The docs for installation and use can be found at userportal.smartdatanet.it/reference.

widgets 1.0 strenght is the composer tool, which allows to create dashboards prototypes, by drag-and-drop of the widgets, with configuration and real time view

Widgets 2.0

Those are widgets developed in Angular 9. They are available as components that can be used in Angular apps and are available as custom components, which are standalone components e independent from the framework used in the webapp.
page_install_overview_intro:
Yucca offers a series of widgets which can be used to represent relevant data. All widgets are highly customizable, in choosing data to show and in the appearance.
Depending on the technology used, you need to choose widgets in version 1.0 or widgets in version 2.0

Widget 1.0

Those are widgets developed in AngularJS, suitable to be used in AngularJS webapp and in not single-page webapps. The docs for installation and use can be found at userportal.smartdatanet.it/reference.

widgets 1.0 strenght is the composer tool, which allows to create dashboards prototypes, by drag-and-drop of the widgets, with configuration and real time view

Widgets 2.0

Those are widgets developed in Angular 9. They are available as components that can be used in Angular apps and are available as custom components, which are standalone components e independent from the framework used in the webapp.
install_angular_intro: Angular Components library has been published on the npm repository.
install_angular_angularcli_intro: To install by Angular CLI browse to project root and run
install_angular_npm_intro: To install by npm browse to project root and run
install_custom_intro:
Custom Elements library has been published on the npm repository.
This library consists in a single javascript file, wich contains all needed dependencies.
At installation time you also get some Geojson files, which can be used for maps widgets
install_custom_npm_intro: To install by npm browse to project root and run
use_angular_intro:
Each widget is made up of a single component, defined by a selector which starts by <yucca-.
there are different widget types: with graphic representations, maps, data views, controls.
use_angular_parameters_content:
Each widget needs some parameters to work. Some of them are the same in in most of widgets, unrelated to the content, as title/subtitle, width/height, any technical info, as security token, o the data url. Others are specific of the single widget.

In the detail tabs of any widget is shown the full list of needed parameters, with description and a real example.

each parameters has to be set in componet.ts and read in the template
use_angular_events_content:
Widgets are standalone elements, they communicate with each other by a series of custom events. When the user interacts with a widget area, for example a mouse click on a graphic's area, the widget emits a specific event, which can be listened by other widgets of the page to update aggiornarsi consequently.

There are few widgets, not related to yucca data, which are used only to emit events, as data filters or something.

On each widget may be set an unique id, which che identifies the emitter widget. This can be useful to other widgets whether or not to listen the event.
By default widgets listens to every eventi, but you can set a filter for the listened events
use_custom_intro:
Each widget is made up of a single component, defined by a selector which starts by <yucca-.
there are different widget types: with graphic representations, maps, data views, controls.
use_custom_parameters_content:
Each widget needs some parameters to work. Some of them are the same in in most of widgets, unrelated to the content, as title/subtitle, width/height, any technical info, as security token, o the data url. Others are specific of the single widget.

In the detail tabs of any widget is shown the full list of needed parameters, with description and a real example.

each parameters has to be set in the script before adding it to the page
use_custom_events_content:
Widgets are standalone elements, they communicate with each other by a series of custom events. When the user interacts with a widget area, for example a mouse click on a graphic's area, the widget emits a specific event, which can be listened by other widgets of the page to update aggiornarsi consequently.

There are few widgets, not related to yucca data, which are used only to emit events, as data filters or something.

On each widget may be set an unique id, which che identifies the emitter widget. This can be useful to other widgets whether or not to listen the event.
By default widgets listens to every eventi, but you can set a filter for the listened events
page_widgets_intro: There are different widget types: with graphic representations, maps, tables, or other view types.  are few widgets, not related to yucca data, which are used only to interact with other widgets in the page.
widget_demo_intro: Here you can see a working example of the widget, comparing the code with the result, seeing dataset structure and his data
widget_detail_sticky_angular_html: Copy and paste in the template
widget_detail_sticky_angular_ts: Copy and paste in the component
widget_detail_sticky_custom_html: Copy and paste in the page
widget_detail_sticky_custom_js: Copy and paste in the script
widget_configurator_toolbar_widgettitle_: Name of the widget used to save in the composer
widget_configurator_start_message: Select the widget to set up
widget_configurator_help_context_widget_: Here you can select the widget type to configure
After choosing a widget type, here will be the list of needed parameters. For each parameter is possibvle to select a value by a dropdown which helps in his filling
widget_configurator_help_context_side_to:
3
    With this toolbar you can
  • Select a name for the configuration and then retreive it by localstorage or a file
  • load a configuration of saved widget
  • save widget configuration for later use (will be generated a json file)
  • view and copy needed code for the widget with all parameters set
  • open and close help
widget_configurator_help_context_main:
Widget configurator

The configurator allows to choose a widget type 1 and prepare it by adding parameters 2 and see a real time result. When satisfied, you can view and copy the code to be paste in your webapp 3 and save the configuration
widget_code_export_intro: By the type of your webapp, choose the code to copy and paste
detail_parameters_intro: This widget Questo widget expects those parameters
detail_styles_intro: This widget Questo widget expects those css classes to define his style
detail_accessibility_intro: Open example widget in a new page to verify his accessibility
detail_configurator_intro: Set your dataset parameters in the configurator and see in real time the generated widget. Once satisfied by the result, you can copy the needed code to integrate in your webapp
accessibility_intro: In this page is shown the widget in static form, so the source code of the page contains the html code generated by widget's javascript
param_type_tenantcode_popup_intro: Start by typing 2 characters of the work area you want to choose, a suggest will help you in the choice
param_type_datasetcode_popup_title: Dataset code dataset associated to selected tenant code
param_type_datasetcode_popup_intro: Start by typing 2 characters of the dataset code you want to choose, a suggest will help you in the choice
param_type_datasetcolumns_popup_intro: Start by typing 2 characters of the column name you want to choose, a suggest will help you in the choice
group_param_dataset_intro: Parameters needed by widget to identify the dataset to process
group_param_common_intro: Common parameters for every widget, as viewable info (a title, an intro paragraph...) or widget dimensions
group_param_advanced_intro: Advanced parameters to manage data access mode by server proxy or by auth token
group_param_odata_intro: Parameters for filtering, sorting, page data from api
group_param_render_intro: Parameters to customize widget's view, as the colors or the numbers
group_param_axis_intro: Parameters to customize values on axes X, Y and/or Y2
group_style_common_intro: Common classes included in each widget
param_help_tenantcode: The code of the area belonged by the dataset/stream
param_help_widgetId:
The id of the html tag of the widget, by default is randomly generated.
Warning: the id must be unique into the dashboard
param_help_widgetWidth: Width in pixel of the widget, if not set it occupies 100% of the parent panel
param_help_widgetHeight: Height in pixel of the widget, by default it uses the width dimension
param_help_axisRotated: Swap X axis and Y axis
param_help_xAxis:
• show It sets whether to show or not the axis. Default: true
  • type Axis type. Possible values timeseries, category, indexed. Default: indexed
  • max Indicates the maximum value of the X axis range.
  • min Indicates the minimum value of the X axis range.
  • label Axis label. It's possible to set its position.If the axis is horizontal
    • inner-right default
    • inner-center
    • inner-left
    • outer-right
    • outer-center
    • outer-left
    If the axis is vertical
    • inner-top default
    • inner-middle
    • inner-bottom
    • outer-top
    • outer-middle
    • outer-bottom
param_help_yAxis:
• show It sets whether to show or not the axis. Default: true
  • type Axis type. Possible values timeseries, linear, log (experimental) . Default: linear
  • inner Shows Y axis in the chart
  • inverted Reverses directionfrom top to bottom. Default: false
  • max Indicates the maximum value of the Y axis range.
  • min Indicates the minimum value of the Y axis range.
  • label Axis label. It's possible to set its position with the same option as the X axis
param_help_xAxisTick:
Available config
  • centered align label text at center. Default: true
  • culling reduces the number of notches. It's possible to set the max number of notches specifing the parameter culling.max
  • count sets the number of ticks of the x axis to show.
  • rotate rotates labels of the set angle in degrees
  • outer hides starting and ending in degrees of the axis
  • multiline set whether or not to show the label in multiple lines
  • multilineMax sets the max number of lines of the label
param_help_yAxisTick:
Available config
  • count sets the number of ticks of the y axis to show.
  • outer hides starting and ending in degrees of the axis
param_help_groupByColumn_discretebarChar: The dataset column to group on
param_help_serieColumns_discretebarChart: Columns which represents the Y axis
param_help_valuesAsCategory_discretebarC: Uses column values to set categories to group on
param_help_nodeColumns_sankeyDiagram: The dataset column to group on
param_help_valueColumn_sankeyDiagram: Columns which represents the Y axis
param_help_valueColumn_singleData: The dataset column which contains the shown value, the widget extracts the first value of the column in KEY
param_help_growAnimation_singleData: if TRUE, if it's a numeric value shows the animation
param_help_sort_sankeyDiagram: on which column sort the dyagram
param_help_barRatio_discretebarChart:
Number between 0 and 1 which sets the width of the barchart: 1 occupies all the width.
↔ For use as an alternative to barWidth.
Default: 0.6
param_help_barWidth_discretebarChart:
Width in pixel of the bars
↔ For use as an alternative to barRatio
param_help_zerobased_discretebarChart:
Sets the minimum or maximum value to zero.
Default: true
param_help_groupByColumn_discreteTable: The dataset column to group on
param_help_barWidth_horizontalMultiBarCh:
Width in pixel of the bars
↔ For use as an alternative to barRatio
param_help_usertoken:
Token to view private datasets/streams.
Attenzione This token will be visible on source code of the page. Use only in develop environment or private dashboards. For public dashboards set the token in server component
param_help_apiDataUrl:
Base url to load data. If void data will be load direcly by Yucca's odata api. The use of a server component L'utilizzo di una componente server which links dashboard and odata api is useful when data are private and you want to use the security token. The token has to be used on the server part: the dasboard calls the api whithout token, the server component injects the token. it's possible to set even a relative url, as /componente_server/. The important thing is ending the url with / so the widget will concatenate the dataset code to the url.
While exporting the dashboard as java or php app there will be also the source codes in the 2 languages, wich can be useful for custom develops
param_help_cache: Sets whether or not to use cache in odata api calls. Useful if in the same app, will be used often the same dataset. The cache is active on the single session, refreshing the page, also the data will be loaded again
param_help_debug: Shows any error messages in the widget, it is recommended to use it only in development phase
detail_intro_lineChart: This widget represents the behaviour of one or more value series over time
detail_datasource_lineChart: The widget expects a dataset with a time column with numeric data (identified by the parameter 'Colonna del tempo') and one or more columns with numeric values (identificate dal parametro 'Value column')
detail_datasource_example_lineChart:
Colonna del tempoValue column 
AnnoArrivi italianiArrivi Stranieri
200812355552344
201413069642365
201815685268221
param_help_groupByColumn_lineChart: The dataset column to group on
param_help_serieColumns_lineChart: Columns which represents the Y axis
param_help_groupByDatetime_lineChart: Sets whether or not to group by date
detail_listen_events_singleData:
• OData query filter
  • Highlight column to group on
detail_sent_events_singleData: This widget doesn't emit any event
param_help_groupByColumn_singleData: The dataset column to group on
param_help_serieColumns_singleData: Columns which represents the Y axis
param_help_groupByDatetime_singleData: Sets whether or not to group by date
detail_intro_discreteTable: This table widget represents calculated data for a classes distribution of a continuous character
detail_datasource_discreteTable: The widget expects a dataset which has a column to group on, and one or more columns with values. These columns may have values to sum or even just occurrences to count
detail_listen_events_discreteTable: This widget doesn't listen to any event
detail_sent_events_discreteTable: This widget doesn't emit any event
detail_related_widget_discreteTable:
• Pie chart
  • Multibar chart
  • Bar chart
  • Horizontal bar chart
  • Choropletic map
detail_intro_horizontalMultiBarChart: This widget may compare series of data grouped by categories, setting one or more series on a side of the chart and one or more on the other. A tipical use of this chart is the age pyramid, where data are grouped by age ranges and on a side are shown female counts and on the other side the male ones.
detail_datasource_horizontalMultiBarChar:
This widget expect two types of dataset
Group by column
Series are identified by different dataset's columns set by the parameter 'Colonne per serie di dati'.
Group by values
Series are identified by grouping of single values of the column set in the parameter 'Colonna con il valore'
In both cases, data will then be gouped by values of the column set by the parameter 'Colonna su cui raggruppare'. This groupinh is shown on the Y axis. Differently by the Widget 'Multi bar chart', it's possible to set the side in which represent every data series.
detail_listen_events_horizontalMultiBarC:
• Change of the column to group on
  • Change oData filter criteria
detail_intro_discretebarChart: This table widget represents a classes distribution of a continuous character
detail_datasource_discretebarChart: The widget expects a dataset which has a column to group on data, which will be shown on the X axis ("Colonna su cui raggruppare"), and a column with values to count, which will be shown on the Y axis ("Colonna con il valore"). This last column may have values to sum or even just occurrences to count
detail_datasource_example_discretebarCha:
In the image example, the chosen dataset has a series of lines with tourists arrivals, by province, year and sector, in the chart has been chosen to group on province

 Column to group onValue column 
YearProvinceTotal Arrivals
2008BI642
2014NO670
2018CN506
detail_listen_events_discretebarChart:
• Change of the column to group on
  • Change of the column to count on
  • Change oData filter criteria
detail_intro_pieChart: This widget shows the distribution of data by not orderable categories. Graphic representation can be customized, by chosing colors and shape
detail_intro_sankeyDiagram: This widget represents a flow chart in which nodes size is shown proportionally to the flow quantity. Sankey diagram is useful when is needed to identify more significant sections of a general flow. The diagram is useful also when  è utile anche quando is needed to show specific quantities maintained within the boundaries of a defined system.
detail_datasource_sankeyDiagram: The widget expects two or more columns to group vertically the nodes on (set in the parameter 'Colonne') and a column which represents values to be shown in the flows (set by parameter 'Colonna con il valore')
detail_intro_treemap: This widget represents hierarchical data by using nested rectangles. each retangle has a specific css class, by which is possible to customize his color
detail_datasource_treemap: The widget expects a series of columns on which navigate data (set by param 'Colonne da navigare'), those furthermore grouped by values of a column (set by parameter 'Colonna con il valore'). It's possible to set one more column to group data on (set by parameter 'Colonna con un secondo valore'). In the final view, rectasngles area will be proportional to values by the first grouping, while colors intensity will be relative to the second grouping
detail_intro_multiChart: This widget shoes series of data so that is possible to compare their results. For each serie of data is possible to customize the chart type (line, bar, area), color, hatching type, Y axis to refer to (it is possible to set 2 differents Y axes, whith different scales)
detail_datasource_multiChart: The chart needs a time column which will be shoen on the X axis set by parameter "Column to group on" and a value column for each data series, set by parameter "Value column"
detail_datasource_dataexplorerTable: Any dataset which can be shown in a table, so dataset structure has to be flat (not nested)
param_help_columnsToShow_dataexplorerTab: A string array of columns to show. Strings should coincide to names of the dataset columns con i nomi delle colonne del dataset
detail_intro_choroplethMap: This widget represents a thematic map in which areas colors represents the calculated statistic result
detail_datasource_choroplethMap: The widget expects a dataset which has a column to group on data ("Colonna su cui raggruppare"), a value column ("Colonna con il valore"). In parameter "Geojson da utilizzare" has to be set the geojson file by which to represent the map. In the geojson file each map area is indicated by a Feature element, which has as attributes, polygon coordinates to represent and at leas a code to identify that polygon (for example a province acronym). This code should coincide with the value of the dataset column "Colonna su cui raggruppare". For some Geojson files, is possible to set his geographic projection ("Proiezioni geografica")
detail_listen_events_choroplethMap:
• Change of the column to group on
  • Change of the column to count on
  • Change oData filter criteria
detail_sent_events_choroplethMap:
• Highlighting of a map area
  • Change of the column to group on
param_help_noDataColor_choroplethMap: The color to show on no data areas
param_help_rangeColors_choroplethMap: Colors to show for each value range (ex. for temperatures below 0, could be used light blue, for valori above 0 could be used red)
style_help_widgetMain: Main panel which contains all the widget
style_help_header: Widget title, shown only if set the parameter widgetTitle
style_help_headerSmall: Widget subtitle, shown only if set the parameter widgetSubitle
style_help_intro: Widget intro paragraph, shown only if set the parameter widgetIntro
style_help_chartContent: Panel which contains the dynamic part of the widget, which could be a chart, a table, ...
style_help_loader: Panel which contains the loading animation shown while data are loaded
style_help_chart: Is the main widget, set dimensions by parameters widgetWidth and widgetHeight are applied to this panel
style_help_debug: Panel showing potential messages shown when parameter debug is set to true
style_name_discretebarMain_discretebarCh: Principal panel of the Discrete barchart
style_help_discretebarMain_discretebarCh: Is a css class added in the principal panel of the 'Discrete barchart'
style_name_choropletMapMain_choroplethMa: Principal panel of the Choropletic map
style_help_choropletMapMain_choroplethMa: Is a css class added in the principal panel of the 'Choropletic map'
style_name_horizontalChartMain_horizonta: Principal panel of the Horizontal bar chart
style_help_horizontalChartMain_horizonta: Is a css class added in the principal panel of the 'Horizontal bar chart'
style_name_lineChartMain_lineChart: Principal panel of the Line chart
style_help_lineChartMain_lineChart: Is a css class added in the principal panel of the 'Line chart'
style_name_multiChartMain_multiChart: Principal panel of the Multibar chart
style_help_multiChartMain_multiChart: Is a css class added in the principal panel of the 'Multibar chart'
style_name_pieChartMain_pieChart: Principal panel of the Pie chart
style_help_pieChartMain_pieChart: Is a css class added in the principal panel of the 'Pie chart'
style_name_sankeyMain_sankeyDiagram: Principal panel of the Sankey diagram
style_help_sankeyMain_sankeyDiagram: Is a css class added in the principal panel of the 'Sankey diagram'
style_help_treemapMain_treemap: Is a css class added in the principal panel of the 'Treemap'
filterDatasetSelect_introshort: Control to change the filter on the source data
param_help_valueColumn_choroplethMap: Is the dataset columnt which contains the values
param_help_groupByColumn_choroplethMap: The dataset column to group on
param_help_geojsons: Is the url of the Geojson which draws the map
param_help_geoprojection:
Is the Geographic projection of the map:
  • mercator Default
  • azimuthalEqualArea
  • azimuthalEquidistant
  • conicConformal
  • conicEqualArea
  • conicEquidistant
  • equirectangular
  • gnomonic
  • orthographic
  • stereographic
param_help_borderColor: Is the color of map's colors
param_help_numberFormat:
• decimal numbers to show after the decimal point
  • isEuro boolean which sets whether or not data shown are euros (Adds symbol €)
  • formatBigNumber shows big numbers with suffix mila (Ex. 2540 is shown as 2,54 mila)
  • textAfter string to add as suffix
  • lang language
param_help_colors:
Colors to be used in the chart:
  • {chartColors: ['color1','color2', ...]} uses set colors in hex format
  • { mainChartColor: 'color' }
    • shows data as shades of selected color
detail_listen_events_multiChart:
• Change of the column to group on
  • OData query filter
param_help_groupByColumn_multiChart: The dataset column to group on
param_help_serieColumns_multiChart: Columns which represents the Y axis
param_help_groupByDatetime_multiChart: Sets whether or not to group by date
detail_datasource_pieChart: The widget expects a dataset with a column to group on data (set by parameter 'Colonna su cui raggruppare'), and a value column (set by parameter 'Colonna con il valore')
detail_listen_events_pieChart:
• Change of the column to group on
  • Change of the column to count on
  • Change oData filter criteria
param_help_groupByColumn_pieChart: The dataset column to group on
param_help_valueColumn_pieChart: Is the dataset column which contains values
param_help_filter: It is possible to set a filter as argument
param_help_otherFilterLogic: This parameter sets how to manage a potential second filter from a control widget. Allows to select to mantain the original filter in 'or', or 'and'. If not set, the new filter overrides the old one
param_help_orderby: Order by a column. The string should be the name of the column as is in the dataset
param_help_top: Sets how many rows are extracted. If not set, the max number of lines extracted is 10.000
param_help_skip: Sets the number of lines to skip at data loading
detail_listen_events_treemap:
• Change of the value column
  • OData query filter

param_help_boxRadius_treemap: Value of the shown box radius
param_help_valueColumn_treemap: Is the dataset column which contains values
param_help_rootLabel_treemap: Label to show in the root
detail_listen_events_dataexplorerTable:
• OData query filter
  • Highlight column to group on
param_help_valueColumns_controlSelect: Is the dataset column which contains values
param_help_groupByColumns_controlSelect: Represents the dataset columns to group on
param_help_treeColumns_treemap: The columns on which navigate data
param_help_legend: Object to set legend visibility and position
param_help_groupByColumn_horizontalMulti: The dataset column to group on
param_help_serieColumns_horizontalMultiB: Are the dataset columns which contains values
param_help_barRatio_horizontalMultiBarCh: Bar width. Accepts a value between 0 and 1.
param_help_render_pieChart:
Rendering options
  • type: donut | pie . Pie or donut visualization.
  • donutRatio: Number between 0 amd 1 which represents ratio between the donut and the center. (To be used only on type:donut)
  • title: Title
detail_intro_controlSelect: Widget which allows to group on different columns and show grouped data on multiple tabs
detail_datasource_controlSelect: Use a dataset which can be grouped on multiple columns
param_help_alignItems_controlSelect:
Positioning of the control tabs columns to group on:
  • start: tab set on the left
  • center: tab set at center (Default)
  • end: tab set on the right
param_help_render_controlSelect:
How to render the tabs:
  • button: buttons
  • radio: radio buttons
  • select: drop-down menu
param_help_direction_controlSelect:
How selection tabs are displayed
  • row: in row
  • column: in column
param_help_emptyLabel_controlSelect: Label to show in the empty option of the drop-down menu (To be used only on render: select)
detail_intro_filterDatasetSelect: Widget which allows to change the search filter used at data loading
param_help_alignItems_filterDatasetSelec:
Positioning of the control tabs columns to group on:
  • start: tab set on the left
  • center: tab set at center (Default)
  • end: tab set on the right
param_help_render_filterDatasetSelect:
How to render the tabs:
  • button: buttons
  • radio: radio buttons
  • select: drop-down menu
param_help_direction_filterDatasetSelect:
How selection tabs are displayed
  • row: in row
  • column: in column
param_help_emptyLabel_filterDatasetSelec: Label to show in the empty option of the drop-down menu (To be used only on render: select)
param_help_singleSelection_filterDataset: Flag which sets to show one filter, or more filters simultaneously (flag to be used only on render: tab)
param_help_filters_filterDatasetSelect:
Object array showing possible options. Each object has three attributes
  • label: Label to show
  • condition: Conditions of the odata filter
  • selected: boolean which sets wheter or not the value is selected by default
param_help_subchart:
Experimental
Sub chart navigable and zoomable to select a subset of the X axis
input_colors_modal_choose_main_color: Use different shades of a single color
input_datasetcode_no_datasets_message: The selected work area (tenantcode) hasn't any dataset or you don't have permission to access them
input_datasetcolumn_tenant_or_datasetcod: Is mandatory for datasetcode and tenantcode to have a value
